title: sent messages are not in any sent folder, they just disappear, but reach destination
creator: erik112
content:
I have used Netscape for many years. And Thunderbird. I installed Mobile Thunderbird a few weeks ago on my Android phone, importing the settings from my desktop Thunderbird.

Everything work, just that ALL my sent messages disappear. They reach their destination, but I can’t see them in any sent folder on the phone. Is this a bug? I have checked, that «Subir los correos enviados» (= upload sent messages) is checked. It was already checked. I unchecked, sent mails, no change. Re-checked, sent mails, no change.

Ideas?

Also my «bandeja de salida» (outbox I think) is empty. Only my Sent and sent-mail folders have mails (one seems from the desktop thunderbird, the other from the webinterface).

title: Show remote content for Thunderbird mobile
creator: JimJamie
content: Suddenly, the images within emails are blocked. I need to press Show Content on every email in my Inbox as I read them. No idea why that started. Where, in the Thunderbird app on my Samsung G-20 is the button for Show Remote Content?
